revised_title: Hurricane of October 10, 1846: Destruction in Havana
tldr: The article describes the devastating effects of a hurricane that hit Havana on October 10, 1846. The hurricane lasted for about 10 hours, causing significant damage to buildings and ships in the harbor. The barometer recorded a sharp drop after the hurricane, and the storm appeared to originate from the south before dissipating in Florida. Unlike the 1844 hurricane, this one did not have lightning.
